name: Lower Marshes
role_in_state: salt & reagent frontier; riverine transshipment choke-point
economy_niches: reagent harvesting (peat, algal resins, reed oils)
transshipment, tolls and lighterage for river traffic
smoke-curing and brining of lowland grain
culture_adjustments: riveric dialect heavy with nautical idioms and tide-terms
clan waterfront leases stronger than inland kin networks
seasonal migratory hamlets on islets; fewer permanent burgs
rituals emphasize tide-timed crossings and ancestor-guide markers
constraints: seasonal roads impassible; reliance on waterways
peat soils unsuitable for heavy construction
ritual reagents are scarce, imported and state-taxed
notes: no major burgs; economy organized around clan-owned landing leases
important node for brokerage of reagent consignments to inland states
navigational auguries used but seamanship remains essential
